events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application aiming to cover medical bills and consolidate existing debts.
The loan application was categorised under Personal Loan due to mentions of medical expenses and debt repayment in the application.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to assist the applicant throughout the loan process and answer all questions.
The initial review of the loan application was conducted to check completeness and evaluate the applicant’s stated needs.
The applicant was requested to submit proof of income, medical bills, and bank statements to support the loan application.
All requested documents including income statements, recent medical expense receipts, and bank statements were received successfully.
The credit bureau check was completed to evaluate the applicant’s credit history and to assist with loan risk assessment.
Risk assessment was finalized, considering credit score, income stability, and loan purpose to determine the loan approval potential.
The loan offer including terms, interest rate, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for review and approval.
The applicant provided positive feedback and asked for clarification on repayment options and early payment penalties.
After final evaluation, the loan was approved with favorable terms matching the applicant’s medical and debt consolidation needs.
The approved loan amount was disbursed to the applicant’s bank account to promptly cover the intended medical costs and debts.
A follow-up call was made to ensure the applicant received funds and understood repayment terms and schedules clearly.
The loan application case was formally closed after confirming all funding and support processes were completed satisfactorily.
